segments.text: Do you want to go out for dinner tonight ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Sure . Have you got anywhere in mind ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm starving , so maybe we could go somewhere with large portions .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: That Italian restaurant in the city centre always has large portions . Do you want to go there ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm not really in the mood for Italian , actually . I was thinking of something a bit spicy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: If you want spicy food , then I'd recommend going to a Thai , Indian or Chinese restaurant . How about that Chinese buffet on Cowley Road ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I really like that restaurant ; you get a lot for your money there . But , they've westernized their food , so it's not actually that spicy .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: You're right . Most of their dishes have sweet sauces . We could try that Indian restaurant just down the road from us .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: The Taj ? They're a bit expensive , but they do serve large portions of very hot food .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Shall we bring our own bottle of wine to save some money ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: They'll still charge us a corkage fee .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's right . It'll probably work out to be about the same then anyway .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Don't worry about money . I'll treat you tonight .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Are you sure ? We could go Dutch .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: No , I'll pay . It's my turn anyway . You paid last time .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I won't argue with that ! Let's go !
segments.speaker: S1
